maml:description.maml:para: Clears all NuGet cache files from the machine.
Runs 'dotnet nuget locals all --clear' to clear all files from the NuGet caches on the machine. This includes the global packages cache, HTTP cache, and temp cache folders.
Shows what would happen if the command runs without actually clearing the cache.
Prompts for confirmation before clearing the cache.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Shows what would happen if the command runs without actually clearing the cache.
Prompts for confirmation before clearing the cache.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears all NuGet cache files from the machine.
Shows what cache files would be cleared without actually clearing them.

maml:description.maml:para: Installs the latest MSBuild Structured Log Viewer from https://github.com/KirillOsenkov/MSBuildStructuredLog
Installs the latest MSBuild Structured Log Viewer from https://github.com/KirillOsenkov/MSBuildStructuredLog. Make sure the install location is in your path to use it.
Runs MSBuild with binary logging enabled by default

Wraps the call to MSBuild using common settings to make command line building repeatable. By default, uses binary logging for better performance and structured log output that can be viewed with the MSBuild Structured Log Viewer.
Allows you to add additional arguments to the MSBuild command. Can be a string or array of strings.
Enables console logging, which will slow down the build process but give you immediate visual feedback. Handy for debugging build issues.
Runs the build with the Clean target before the main build to remove all build artifacts.
Runs the build with the Restore target before the main build to restore NuGet packages.
Calls 'dotnet nuget locals all --clear' to remove all cached packages. You will need to restore after this.
Sets the build configuration to Release instead of Debug.
Deletes all folders with names specified in NukeFolders parameter (default: bin, obj, node_modules, out, TestResults).
Performs a complete git reset: deletes all extra files, resets the git repo to the last commit, and pulls the latest changes. WARNING: This will permanently delete uncommitted changes.
Shows the build performance summary in the console output when LogToConsole is enabled.
By default, 'dotnet tool restore' is run before the build. This switch skips that step.
Sets the verbosity level for MSBuild logging. Valid values: quiet, minimal, normal, detailed, diagnostic. Default is 'minimal'.
Specifies which folder names to delete when using the Nuke parameter. Default folders: bin, obj, node_modules, out, TestResults.
A ScriptBlock that handles informational messages during the build process. Default writes to Write-Information.
A ScriptBlock that handles error messages during the build process. Default writes to Write-Error.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs a basic debug build with binary logging enabled.
Runs a build with detailed console output instead of binary logging.
Performs a complete build: restore packages, clean artifacts, then build in release mode.
Deletes build folders and runs build with additional MSBuild arguments.
Clears the NuGet cache and restores packages before building.
Runs build with console logging, showing build performance summary with normal verbosity.

maml:description.maml:para: Runs MBuild with binary logging enabled by default and with Release configuration
Wraps the call to msbuild using common settings to make command lind building repeatable.
Allows you to add additional arguments to the msbuild command.
Enabled Console logging, this will slow down the build process but give you immediate visual feedback. Handy for debugging.
Runs the build with the Clean step as the target before the main build.
Runs the build with the Restore step as the target before the main build.

Installs the Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.NuGet.AuthHelper nuget and runs it.

Installs the Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.NuGet.AuthHelper nuget in a '.tools' folder in your profile. It then runs it against a nuget.config in the directory you executed the command in. This will auth you against all the endpoints in the nuget.config and cache them. This allows for faster and simpler restore from the command line.
Location of 'nuget.config' to get external feeds from.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
